definition: to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Physical health qualifications of blood donors shall be laid down by the department of public health under the State Council.
sentences.chinese: 獻血者的身體健康條件由國務院衛生行政部門規定。

sentences.english: Likewise, a person who donates blood is not in contact with the person receiving it.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的，獻血者也不會接觸到受血者。

sentences.english: Mistake management in blood station is very important for blood donors and recipients' safety.
sentences.chinese: 血站差錯管理對獻血者和受血者的安全至關重要。

sentences.english: The rate of donation adverse reactions on mobile blood collecting vehicles was relatively high.
sentences.chinese: 流動採血車獻血者獻血反應發生率較高。

sentences.english: It showed that the plasmapheresis donors were the risk population to be infected with malaria.
sentences.chinese: 證實了單採漿獻血者是感染瘧疾的危險人羣。

sentences.english: A large crowd of relatives and blood donors gathered at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 很多軍人家屬和志願獻血者聚集在醫院裏。
